name: Mafia / Werewolf
description: Mafia (also known as Werewolf) is a social deduction game, created by Dimitry Davidoff in 1986. The game models a conflict between two groups: an informed minority (the mafia or the werewolves), and an uninformed majority (the innocents). At the start of the game, each player is secretly assigned a role affiliated with one of these teams.
equipment: A deck of cards to assign roles (or a dedicated Mafia/Werewolf game set)
basicRules: The game has two phases: night and day.
During the night phase, the mafia (or werewolves) secretly choose an innocent to 'kill'.
During the day phase, the 'killed' player is revealed, and the remaining players debate the identities of the mafia members and vote to eliminate a suspect.
The game continues until either all of the mafia have been eliminated (the innocents win) or the mafia outnumber the innocents (the mafia win).
There are many variations of the game with different roles and rules.
tips: If you are an innocent, pay attention to how people are voting and what they are saying.
If you are in the mafia, try to blend in and cast suspicion on other players.
